author: obi0837
content: Hi all, One question regarding eth 2.0 fees bugging me a lot . Will tx fees in eth 2.0 will be burned like now ? and what will be the block reward in eth 2.0 which will go to stakers?

author: pietjepuk
content:
> Will tx fees in eth 2.0 will be burned like now 
Yes, nothing will change on the execution layer side. Just the consensus protocol will change.

>  and what will be the block reward in eth 2.0 which will go to stakers?
Not 2 ETH per block if that's what you're wondering. The reward issued to stakers will remain the same as it is now (see e.g. https://beaconcha.in for what rewards are currently issued). 

Issuance goes from ~4% inflation with PoW to ~0.5% with just PoS after merge iirc. (Currently we have both in parallel, so ~4.5%)

author: pietjepuk
content: And horrible confusion caused by the term "ETH 2.0", which is/was nothing more than an umbrella term for certain long term improvements to Ethereum (think PoS, sharding, state expiry). There is no ETH 2.0 though, it is and always will be "just" Ethereum

author: pietjepuk
content: Well, rollups save on gas fees by compressing e.g. calldata and making general transfers of ETH very cheap. And they don't rely on the base shard having execution capabilities, which is definitely the plan for all but one shard. So not quite sure what you mean when you think it _isn't_ (part of) a scaling solution. But iirc <@!129305432891195393> already explained this over in <#829412277782315008>
